results.title: Making learning more meaningful
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
Learning arithmetic and money-handling by producing play money - setting up a mint, a bank and a grocery store in a primary school grade.

results.title: Developmental characteristics of pre-adolescence
results.creator_credit: Herbert Kerkow and Herbert Kerkow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
As the child grows toward maturity, successive stages of development are apparent - each stage has a distinctive pattern of behaviour. A study of the daily life of an eight-year-old girl and a nine-year-old boy illustrates the chief development characteristics of pre-adolescents. Their patterns of behaviour provide information on developing a curriculum suitable to their needs and educational experiences.

results.title: Each child is different
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
Dramatised incidents are used in presenting a study of five fifth-grade children, whose personalities and backgrounds present typical problems. The film explains the importance of the elementary school teacher’s knowledge of the complex and different backgrounds of the children, as well as their individual abilities and needs, in order to adjust the teaching program to meet these needs.

group_siblings.title: Muscular strength and endurance

results.title: Muscular strength and endurance
results.creator_credit: D. David Bash and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyone’s a Winner”.
Describes a program for developing strength and endurance of the upper body, arms and abdominal muscles. Includes the correct ways to do knee-bent situps, chair pushups and pullups, and how to limber up before exercising.

results.title: Well laid plans (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Central to all management action is planning and decision making. Both involve information collecting and making choices. In some situations it is best to involve others in the process. Planning and decision making in situations of high certainty are considered in the context of present day management culture.

results.title: Who's in control (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
To carry out a plan or implement a decision a degree of organisation needs to occur. What individuals do (job design), how people relate formally to one another (organisational structure) and how this gets co-ordinated are the essential organising activities. At the same time, mechanisms to establish if the planning, organising, motivating, etc. is achieving what intended to occur. Self correcting control or control followed by corrective action needs to be built into all management processes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
